data.text: a speech sound or series of speech sounds that symbolizes and communicates a meaning usually without being divisible into smaller units capable of independent use
examples: the order of words in a phrase
the meaning of a word
a word that rhymes with her name
… signage shows visitors how to sign the word “goat”—while a goat pokes his head through the fence.
The word go also has the forms goes, going, went, and gone.
the number of words to a line
a word of advice
I would like to have a word with you.
For the first time through his own words, witness the journey of a shy but prodigious musical talent who would soon become one of the defining artists of his generation.
putting one's feelings into words
wonderful beyond words =beyond what can be expressed in language
Don't move till I give the word.
We will wait for your word before we serve dinner.
sent word that they would be late
Any word on how they are?
If word gets out, we're all in trouble.
Word has it that the event is going to be cancelled.
kept their word
I won't go back on my word.
… the Dodgers have lived up to their word.
… the precepts of God's Word: "Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself."
… preach the Word to those of their people who had formerly floundered without it.
… the Incarnation, the belief that in Christ the Word was made flesh.
loyal in word and deed
One remembers his first modest advertisements headed with the magic word Thrift, Thrift, Thrift, thrice repeated …

data.text: a gesture or series of gestures that symbolizes and communicates a meaning of an object or concept: sign
examples: the order of words in a phrase
the meaning of a word
a word that rhymes with her name

data.text: the entire set of linguistic forms produced by combining a single base with various inflectional elements without change in the part of speech elements
examples: the order of words in a phrase
the meaning of a word
a word that rhymes with her name
… signage shows visitors how to sign the word “goat”—while a goat pokes his head through the fence.
The word go also has the forms goes, going, went, and gone.

a carefully worded reply
Could we word the headline differently?
The exact way to word the conversation depends on you—and your friendship.
a carefully worded reply
Could we word the headline differently?
The exact way to word the conversation depends on you—and your friendship.

data.text: a test of personality and mental function in which the subject is required to respond to each of a series of words with the first word that comes to mind or with a word of a specified class of words (such as antonyms)
a linguistic form class whose members are words; especially: part of speech
being in or following the exact words: verbatim
examples: a word-for-word translation

data.text: the use of empty or bombastic words
orally communicated; also: generated from or reliant on oral publicity
examples: word-of-mouth customers
a word-of-mouth business

data.text: oral communication; especially: oral often inadvertent publicity
